awd_abstract_narration: For over 35 years Dr. Rogers McVaugh has done floristic                    research on the vascular plants of southwestern Mexico, in an                   area centered on the state of Jalisco and known as Nueva Galicia.               For the last 30 years that work has been supported by the                       National Science Foundation.  McVaugh's research is now bearing                 fruit in the form of the Flora Novo-Galiciana, a 17-volume series               to be published at the University of Michigan.  Four volumes,                   treating the four largest families, have already been published.                This project will provide partial support for publication of the                fifth volume, now ready for publication.  It will be designated                 Volume 15 and will treat the monocot families from Bromeliaceae                 to Dioscoreaceae.

inst.inst_name: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
